intro: Stylidium calcaratum var. ecorne, commonly known as the horned sun-orchid, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals that resemble horns. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Stylidium calcaratum var. ecorne is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
